briefdescription.para: Macro for creating an instance of the SPIM driver.

memberdef.name: NRFX_SPIM_DEFAULT_CONFIG
memberdef.initializer: { \ .sck_pin = _pin_sck, \ .mosi_pin = _pin_mosi, \ .miso_pin = _pin_miso, \ .ss_pin = _pin_ss, \ .ss_active_high = false, \ .irq_priority = NRFX_SPIM_DEFAULT_CONFIG_IRQ_PRIORITY, \ .orc = 0xFF, \ .frequency = NRFX_MHZ_TO_HZ(4), \ .mode = NRF_SPIM_MODE_0, \ .bit_order = NRF_SPIM_BIT_ORDER_MSB_FIRST, \ .miso_pull = NRF_GPIO_PIN_NOPULL, \ NRFX_COND_CODE_1(NRFX_SPIM_EXTENDED_ENABLED, (.use_hw_ss = false,), ()) \ NRFX_COND_CODE_1(NRFX_SPIM_EXTENDED_ENABLED, (.ss_duration = NRF_SPIM_CSNDUR_DEFAULT,), ()) \ NRFX_COND_CODE_1(NRFX_SPIM_EXTENDED_ENABLED, (.rx_delay = NRF_SPIM_RXDELAY_DEFAULT,), ()) \ NRFX_COND_CODE_1(NRFX_SPIM_EXTENDED_ENABLED, (.dcx_pin = NRF_SPIM_PIN_NOT_CONNECTED,), ()) \ }

briefdescription.para: SPIM driver default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This configuration sets up SPIM with the following options:
SS pin active low
over-run character set to 0xFF
clock frequency: 4 MHz
mode: 0 (SCK active high, sample on leading edge of the clock signal)
MSB shifted out first
MISO pull-up disabled

parameterdescription.para: SCK pin.
MOSI pin.
MISO pin.
Slave select pin.

briefdescription.para: Macro for checking whether specified frequency can be achieved for a given SPIM instance.

simplesect.para: This macro uses a compile-time assertion.

parameterdescription.para: Index of the specified SPIM instance.
Desired frequency value in Hz.

briefdescription.para: Macro for getting base frequency value in Hz for a given SPIM instance.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Flag indicating that TX buffer address will be incremented after transfer.
Flag indicating that RX buffer address will be incremented after transfer.
Flag indicating that the interrupt after each transfer will be suppressed, and the event handler will not be called.
Flag indicating that the transfer will be set up, but not started.
Flag indicating that the transfer will be executed multiple times.
Macro for setting up single transfer descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: This macro is for internal use only.

Macro for setting the TX transfer.
Macro for setting the RX transfer.
Macro returning SPIM interrupt handler.
Transfer done.
SPIM master driver event types, passed to the handler routine provided during initialization.
Single transfer descriptor structure.
SPIM driver event handler type.

memberdef.name: nrfx_spim_init

briefdescription.para: Function for initializing the SPIM driver instance.

detaileddescription.para: This function configures and enables the specified peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the initial configuration. NULL if configuration is to be skipped and will be done later using nrfx_spim_reconfigure.
Event handler provided by the user. If NULL, transfers will be performed in blocking mode.
Context passed to event handler.

simplesect.para: On nRF5340, 32 MHz setting for SPIM4 peripheral instance is supported only on the dedicated pins with NRF_GPIO_PIN_SEL_PERIPHERAL configuration. See the chapter Pin assignments in the Product Specification.

parameterdescription.para: Initialization was successful.
The driver is already initialized.
The driver is already initialized. Deprecated - use NRFX_ERROR_ALREADY instead.
Some other peripheral with the same instance ID is already in use. This is possible only if Peripheral Resource Sharing (PRS) module is enabled.
Requested configuration is not supported by the SPIM instance.
Requested frequency is not available on the specified driver instance or pins.

briefdescription.para: Function for reconfiguring the SPIM driver instance.

simplesect.para: This function can not be called during transmission.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the configuration.
Reconfiguration was successful.
The driver is during transfer.
The driver is uninitialized.
Requested configuration is not supported by the SPIM instance.
Requested frequency is not available on the specified driver instance or pins.
Software-controlled Slave Select and hardware-controlled Slave Select cannot be active at the same time.

briefdescription.para: Function for uninitializing the SPIM driver instance.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the SPIM driver instance is initialized.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Instance is already initialized.
Instance is not initialized.

briefdescription.para: Function for starting the SPIM data transfer.

detaileddescription.para: Additional options are provided using the flags parameter:

listitem.para: NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_TX_POSTINC and NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_RX_POSTINC - Post-incrementation of buffer addresses.

NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_HOLD_XFER - Driver is not starting the transfer. Use this flag if the transfer is triggered externally by PPI. Use nrfx_spim_start_task_address_get to get the address of the start task. Chip select must be configured to NRF_SPIM_PIN_NOT_CONNECTED and managed outside the driver. If you do not expect more transfers, you should call nrfx_spim_abort to inform the driver that the peripheral can be put into a low power state.

NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER - No user event handler after transfer completion. This also means no interrupt at the end of the transfer. If NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER is used, the driver does not set the instance into busy state, so you must ensure that the next transfers are set up when SPIM is not active. Additionally, you should call nrfx_spim_abort to inform the driver that no more transfers will occur. nrfx_spim_end_event_address_get function can be used to detect end of transfer. Option can be used together with NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER to prepare a sequence of SPI transfers without interruptions. If you do not expect more transfers, you should call nrfx_spim_abort to inform the driver that the peripheral can be put into a low power state.

NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER - Prepare for repeated transfers. You can set up a number of transfers that will be triggered externally (for example by PPI). An example is a TXRX transfer with the options NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_RX_POSTINC, NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER, and NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER. After the transfer is set up, a set of transfers can be triggered by PPI that will read, for example, the same register of an external component and put it into a RAM buffer without any interrupts. nrfx_spim_end_event_address_get can be used to get the address of the END event, which can be used to count the number of transfers. If NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER is used, the driver does not set the instance into busy state, so you must ensure that the next transfers are set up when SPIM is not active. If you do not expect more transfers, you should call nrfx_spim_abort to inform the driver that the peripheral can be put into a low power state.

simplesect.para: Peripherals using EasyDMA (including SPIM) require the transfer buffers to be placed in the Data RAM region. If this condition is not met, this function will fail with the error code NRFX_ERROR_INVALID_ADDR.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the transfer descriptor.
Transfer options (0 for default settings).
The procedure is successful.
The driver is not ready for a new transfer.
The provided parameters are not supported.
The provided buffers are not placed in the Data RAM region.

memberdef.argsstring: (nrfx_spim_t const *p_instance, nrfx_spim_xfer_desc_t const *p_xfer_desc, uint32_t flags, uint8_t cmd_length)
memberdef.name: nrfx_spim_xfer_dcx

briefdescription.para: Function for starting the SPIM data transfer with DCX control.

detaileddescription.para: See nrfx_spim_xfer for description of additional options of transfer provided by the flags parameter.

simplesect.para: Peripherals that use EasyDMA (including SPIM) require the transfer buffers to be placed in the Data RAM region. If this condition is not met, this function will fail with the error code NRFX_ERROR_INVALID_ADDR.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the transfer descriptor.
Transfer options (0 for default settings).

Length of the command bytes preceding the data bytes. The DCX line will be low during transmission of command bytes and high during transmission of data bytes. Maximum value available for dividing the transmitted bytes into command bytes and data bytes is NRF_SPIM_DCX_CNT_ALL_CMD - 1. The NRF_SPIM_DCX_CNT_ALL_CMD value passed as the cmd_length parameter causes all transmitted bytes to be marked as command bytes.
The procedure is successful.
The driver is not ready for a new transfer.
The provided parameters are not supported.
The provided buffers are not placed in the Data RAM region.

briefdescription.para: Function for returning the address of a SPIM start task.

detaileddescription.para: This function is to be used if nrfx_spim_xfer was called with the flag NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_HOLD_XFER. In that case, the transfer is not started by the driver, but it must be started externally by PPI.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for returning the address of a END SPIM event.

detaileddescription.para: The END event can be used to detect the end of a transfer if the NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER option is used.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for aborting ongoing transfer.

simplesect.para: You should call the function if the first transfer has been started with one or more of the following options: NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER, NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_HOLD_XFER, and NRFX_SPIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER. When you do not expect more transfers, use this function so that the driver can put the peripheral into a low power state.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
